intro: Oxandra longipetala, commonly known as the long-petaled oxandra, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elongated leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds. Oxandra longipetala is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
